revised_title: Graham Selby Wilson: A Pioneering Figure in Public Health and Bacteriology
tldr: Graham Selby Wilson was a prominent figure in the fields of bacteriology and public health, making significant contributions to the study of tuberculosis and brucellosis. He co-authored the influential textbook "Topley & Wilson's Principles of Bacteriology and Immunity" and played a crucial role in the establishment of the Public Health Laboratory Service. His dedication to teaching and research left a lasting impact on the field of microbiology.
